description: Rules for handling images, icons, and static assets in VibeX. Ensures performance, consistency, and scalability.
enforcedBy: VibeX AI Staff Engineer & Frontend Build Guard
philosophy: Every asset should be optimized, consistently stored, and never introduce performance bottlenecks.

rules.name: Optimized Image Formats
rules.description: All images must be stored in optimized formats (WebP or AVIF preferred).
guidelines: JPG and PNG are only allowed if optimization tools cannot convert them without quality loss.
Favicon must include multiple sizes (16x16, 32x32, 64x64) in `.ico` or `.png` format.

rules.name: Static Assets Directory Structure
rules.description: All static assets must be stored under `/public/assets/` with clear subfolders.

rules.name: SVG Usage Policy
rules.description: SVGs must be used whenever possible for icons and vector graphics.
guidelines: Inline SVGs if they need to be dynamic (e.g., theming, animations).
Do not use rasterized PNG versions of SVGs.

rules.name: Asset Loading & Performance
rules.description: Assets must be lazy-loaded or optimized for minimal performance impact.
guidelines: Never import images directly into TypeScript/React files unless absolutely necessary (use public folder references).

steps.name: Store in Correct Directory
steps.action: Ensure assets are placed in their dedicated subfolder under `/public/assets/`.

steps.name: Optimize Before Commit
steps.action: Compress and convert images to WebP/AVIF before committing.

steps.name: Apply SVG Best Practices
steps.action: Decide between inline vs. static SVG based on dynamic needs.

steps.name: Run Performance Scan
steps.action: Verify Lighthouse/Pagespeed audit shows no unoptimized images or asset warnings.
